thread.title: Drought Monitor Makes Comeback With Dry Conditions
thread.title_full: Drought Monitor Makes Comeback With Dry Conditions

title: Drought Monitor Makes Comeback With Dry Conditions
text:
Drought Monitor Makes Comeback With Dry Conditions October 19, 2015, 10:06 PM by Scot Mundt SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Monday was a warm and dry day in KELOLAND with highs warming to the 70s and 80s. While the warm and dry weather has been ideal for many area farmers during harvest, it's been taking toll on dry conditions in KELOLAND. 
Western and central KELOLAND are not too bad, but Rapid City and Pierre range from a quarter to a half inch below. Eastern and southeast KELOLAND have been the driest. This is where amounts are close to an inch and a half below average in Sioux Falls to nearly an inch and a quarter in Aberdeen and Watertown. 
Northeast KELOLAND is the area where the drought monitor is making a comeback. It covers an area from near Mobridge to Watertown and northeast. 
We should put a dent in some of the dry conditions later this week as rain is likely Thursday into Friday. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
